page.title: 07TRANSPORT-SCHOOL JOURNEY
page.content: { }The day starts,with me getting up early enough to catch the school bus at 8.20am. It takes me from Westbury to Buckingham 5 miles away.Before reaching us,the bus has called at other small neighbouring villages called Shalstone,Biddlesden and Turweston.My part of the journey takes half an hour.The school day ends at 15.30 but my day isn't over yet.The way home is about 23 miles and takes one and a quarter hours.Although I am last on in the morning,I and my other school friends that live in Westbury, are always home last at 16.45.Our bus service is run by'Rainbows'a private coach company,which is at the northern end of the village.I have travelled on this route for three years and still have another six years to do.
